dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Issa (for himself, Mr. Hudson, and Mr. LaMalfa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit State excise taxes on firearms and ammunition manufacturers and dealers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Freedom from Unfair Gun Taxes Act of 2025.

subsection.text: A State, and any political subdivision thereof, may not levy or collect an excise tax on the sale of a firearm, ammunition, or a part or component of a firearm or ammunition by a manufacturer or dealer that occurs in or affecting interstate or foreign commerce.
Nothing in subsection (a) shall be construed to alter, modify, or otherwise affect the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act (16 U.S.C. 669 et seq.).
